**How to upload a table into your Databricks work space in Microsoft Azure**

Hello,
This post give a quick through of creating a table in Azure Databricks work space

## Prerequisite: 

In order to perform the task, you must have an Azure Databricks account. 
If you have not had that, go to create an Azure account on https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/get-started/azure-portal, then subscribe Databricks to create an Databricks work space, or following instructions in this video 
{{< video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sLkrEXu7KAs>}}

## Create your first table

**Step 1.** Launch your work space Databricks

<center><img src="/images/get_csv_tables_into_databricks/Step 1.png"></center>

**Step 2.** In the sidebar, click **+ New**  to **Add or Upload data**

<center><img src="/images/get_csv_tables_into_databricks/Step 2.png"></center>

**Step 3.** Click on **Create and modify table** 

<center><img src="/images/get_csv_tables_into_databricks/Step 3.png"></center>

**Step 4.** Drop files into the frame or click on **browse** to upload the files (Maximum 10 files and total upload size of 2GB)

<center><img src="/images/get_csv_tables_into_databricks/Step 4.png"></center>

**Step 5.** After files are uploaded, verify then click on **Create Table**

<center><img src="/images/get_csv_tables_into_databricks/Step 5.png"></center>

Here is the table successfully uploaded on the Databrick work space

<center><img src="/images/get_csv_tables_into_databricks/Step 6.png"></center>

To give you a hands-on practice of this work, please following my step-by-step tutorial video to perform all the above steps:
